lexUnit.name: duel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (chiefly historical) a pre-arranged contest with deadly weapons between two people to settle a point of honour

sentence.text: Lord John had sounded hopeless for he knew he would lose a duel against Sharpe .
This year 's final was to have been a duel between the two most successful of all World Cup horses , Milton and Canadian Ian Millar 's Big Ben , who won the final in 1988 and 1989 .
Mayor of Winglebury ( fict. ) , a shady attorney whose muddled intervention averts a duel between Alexander Trott and Horace Hunter , but causes the former to be treated as a lunatic .
The prosecution alleges that Blissett ` cynically and deliberately " thrust his elbow into his opponent 's face during a mid-air duel for the ball .
Under the surface of an everyday conversation a duel of two astute minds was taking place .

Half a century ago Mr Guerra , a fellow Andalucian , would have fought a duel over this remark , but he is happy , come the 29 October elections , to crush Mr Pacheco 's party into the ash-white earth of Jerez .
Rob Andrew won his personal duel with Barnes , ramming in 19 points .
ROBIN Smith , Hampshire 's defiant middle-order maestro , yesterday had the last word in his summer-long bitter duel with Waqar Younis .
The old Warden of the city , a great High Elf mage , was slain in a magical duel with Grom 's greatest shaman , and the people of Tor Yvresse beseeched Eltharion to become their new warden .
He enjoyed a public , after dinner , verbal duel with Dr Strick at Grantley Hall .
( Oh , by the way , Benjamin killed the nobleman concerned in a duel with swords in Leicester Fields .
As late as 1812 the French representative in Naples fought a duel with his Russian colleague over a question of precedence ; and his doing so was officially approved in Paris .
He rarely survived to the final reel , because the notion of Van Cleef nobly agreeing to a duel in a deserted street was ridiculous .
Posidonius enjoyed describing those strictly hierarchical banquets of the Celts in which people challenged each other to mortal duels on fine points of honour , such as the best piece of meat .
The World Chess Championship resumed its second half in Lyons , France on Saturday night with a sharp duel which , nevertheless , burnt out as another draw .
They fought a duel using huge thorns of the sacred crab-apple tree , and Hahgwehdiyu emerged victorious .
